nodes.name: Extract Claims
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it
nodes.hint: Whenever the file is changed, Refresh the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the file/directory

fields.name: separator
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName
fields.title: Whether to add Input File Name as a column in the Dataframe
fields.description: Add the new field:input_file_name

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: Encoding
fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

nodes.name: Extract Providers
nodes.description: This node reads data from Relational Databases using JDBC and creates a DataFrame from it

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: connection
fields.title: Connection
fields.description: The JDBC connection to connect

fields.name: dbtable
fields.title: DB Table
fields.description: The JDBC table that should be read. Note that anything that is valid in a FROM clause of a SQL query can be used. For example, instead of a full table you could also use a subquery in parentheses.

fields.name: partitionColumn
fields.title: PartitionColumn
fields.description: PartitionColumn must be a numeric, date, or timestamp column from the table

fields.name: lowerBound
fields.title: LowerBound
fields.description: lowerBound and upperBound are just used to decide the partition stride, not for filtering the rows in table. So all rows in the table will be partitioned and returned. This option applies only to reading.

fields.name: upperBound
fields.title: UpperBound
fields.description: lowerBound and upperBound are just used to decide the partition stride, not for filtering the rows in table. So all rows in the table will be partitioned and returned. This option applies only to reading.

fields.name: numPartitions
fields.title: NumPartitions
fields.description: The maximum number of partitions that can be used for parallelism in table reading

fields.name: fetchsize
fields.title: FetchSize
fields.description: The JDBC fetch size, which determines how many rows to fetch per round trip.

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names of the Table
fields.description: Output Columns Names of the Table

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types of the Table
fields.description: Output Column Types of the Table

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats
fields.description: Output Column Formats

nodes.name: SQL
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to Schema tab and Refresh the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
select CLAIMID, PATIENT_ID, PROVIDER_ID, ORGANIZATION,NAME,GENDER,SPECIALITY, 
ADDRESS,CITY,STATE,ZIP,LAT,LON,ENCOUNTERS,PROCEDURES, 
TYPE,AMOUNT,METHOD,FROMDATE,TODATE,PLACEOFSERVICE,
PAYMENTS, TRANSFERS, OUTSTANDING 
from fire_temp_table;
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run
